alert.note: Alert for Ector (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 11:54PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL ECTOR COUNTY THROUGH 1245 AM CDT... At 1153 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Odessa, or 14 miles southwest of Odessa, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Odessa, West Odessa, Odessa Schlemeyer Field, and Penwell. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 99 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
